title: Practice Challenge
description:
You'll work with this HTML structure:

Welcome

Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the heading element (use document.getElementById) 2. Finds the button element 3. When button is clicked, change heading text to 'Hello, JavaScript!'
instructions:
You'll work with this HTML structure:

Welcome

Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the heading element (use document.getElementById) 2. Finds the button element 3. When button is clicked, change heading text to 'Hello, JavaScript!'

hints.text: Inside the click function, use: heading.textContent = 'Hello, JavaScript!';

commonMistakes.consequence: document.getElementById(heading) treats 'heading' as a variable, not a string, causing a ReferenceError.
The script runs before the elements exist, returning null and causing errors when you try to use them.
commonMistakes.correction: Put <script> tags at the end of <body>, or use DOMContentLoaded event.
